pr_title: support legacy PagedList for convenience of migration

timeline.author: weidongxu-microsoft

replies.bodyText: what's the deprecation mean? Should v2 still use PagedList or should not?
replies.author: yungezz

timeline.bodyText: Expect user to create it via the standard PagedIterable.
timeline.author: weidongxu-microsoft

timeline.bodyText: seems cachedpage removed, any concern on performance etc when original cachedpage adding? Or we may revisit it later when there's complain
timeline.author: yungezz

replies.bodyText: v2 should not use PagedList. This class is provided since return type in v2 is PagedIterable, which is not compatibly with v1 PagedList.
replies.author: weidongxu-microsoft

replies.bodyText: PagedIterable/PagedFlux is already doing what need to be done on paged response. This class is only a wrapper to provide interface compatible with v1.
replies.author: weidongxu-microsoft

replies.bodyText:
With this, user now have 2 choice when migrate.

Use PagedIterable, and refactor any code that handling it.
Use PagedList, use it to wrap PagedIterable. Find time later to do all refactor needed in 1.
replies.author: weidongxu-microsoft

replies.bodyText: thanks for clarification. Then in our sample or migration guide, pls use PagedIterable as right and long term way for paging operation.
replies.author: yungezz
